WeLearn

Any engineering major will tell you that the most important tool is a good study group. But finding the right teammates often feels like a roll of the dice. WeLearn gives students the control they deserve over their education.

Through WeLearn, students can find the best study mates. They can share their toughest homework problems and their solutions at any time. They can chat, send images, and post to forums for their major.

Students can build their profile and, by helping their peers, they can build a reputation and obtain awesome badges. With WeLearn, students will always have a study group in their pocket and access to new friends.

WeLearn interfaces with Facebook to ensure the security and honesty of its members. It is truly the next step for higher education.
Hero

Problem: The national average response time of EMT and police is 15 minutes.

Solution: Hero is a mobile application compatible with the pebble smart-watch. Hero decreases the EMS (Emergency medical services) notification time and as a result leads to improved overall response time.

How: Through providing accurate GPS (Global Position System) coordinates from Satellites and local Network Towers, nearby friends, families and law enforcement will receive immediate text notifications the customers current address.

Secure: In case of a failed data connection the application will send a google maps link otherwise it will always provide an address every 30 seconds to your emergency contacts.

  • android
  • java
  • photoshop
  • android-studio
  • xml
  • pebble
  • mobile
  • android-wear

Creator of Hero and leader of the team. I made sure the product was executed. I developed majority of the code for the Android mobile device and had the team work on the code implementation for the smart watch.
I was mainly in charge of the design portion of things, as well as working with our team's marketer.
CoFoundr

As young entrepreneurs with specialized skillsets, we found it highly difficult and inefficient to find complementary co-founders to pursue our entrepreneurial ventures. We wanted to create a platform where it was very easy and seamless to find partners who offer specialized skills in the 3 most important positions for starting a company - business, engineering, and design. Our target users are young entrepreneurs, undergraduates, graduate students, and young professionals who are trying to start a company, or join a start up. With the start up ecosystem rapidly developing, there has never been a better time to create this platform.

Key Features:

  • Finding co-founders who offer different skills than yourself
  • algorithm that suggests co-founders for you to partner up with based on your skillsets/personality dimensions
  • swipe right/swipe left "tinder-esque" feature to match with co-founders
  • in app messaging to directly contact potential partners

Built With

  • objective-c
  • photoshop
  • parse
  • sketch
  • invision
PicCrypt

PicCrypt manipulates pixel data in an image to encode a text message into the color information. When you share the picture it will look like an ordinary image that no one would be suspicious of. PicCrypt is also capable of downloading a random image from a free, public domain stock photo website, Pixabay. You specify a search term, download the image, encrypt it, and save it. You can then open the image later to decrypt it. It's easy to use and a fun way to share secret messages.

Built With

  • windows
  • gamemaker
  • pixabay

Armoin

I initially came up with the idea for Armoin after sitting down and playing flappy bird. I thought it would be rather fun to make a simple game that dealt with a knight who only could swing his sword and jump. I called it Swingy Knight. Of course that sat for some time until I started to add components and re-imagine the entire piece as being much deeper and overall much more story focused. So when I contacted Ryan Ridley about building the game it suddenly became a reality of building a 2D platformer. However, progress was not accelerated until Hackathon came about and Manny came into the business which was awesome. Mainly the games that inspired me were Journey, Transistor, Flower, and other smaller independent type games that influenced how I approached the 2D platform. Our target user is the person who is only looking for a casual play but that would be willing to take our content seriously enough to have it emotionally effect them hopefully. A lot of games pack a lot of content in large quantities too big to be piecemealed and so they either become a bore or an absolute grind. People are busy and we don't want to impede they're lives so as a result the game is made to be challenging hopefully but fun and also short for easy completion. The best feature we have in the game is our self-made engine that we built to house our assets. It works wonderfully and I love it a lot. They style of the game is also built around a more vectored lower poly but still smooth coloring and simple shading. The main narrative kept a very linear aspect but I'm excited to find out what happens when we implement the sound reflection component to the game. Thanks to everyone for the chance and especially for Manny and Ryan for allowing this to become a reality.

Built With

  • c
  • c++
  • opengl
  • photoshop
  • codeblocks
  • adobe-illustrator
  • ms-paint

  • github.com

I helped make the animation textures along with the sprints. Besides that I helped come up with the story, game-design, initial level sketches, enemies sketches, and generally just the concept of the game. I also helped make a background though I'm not sure if we implemented that yet.
I wrote the modern OpenGL engine from the ground up in C++. I managed the texture loading and vector libraries with SOIL and glm.

Flag Collection Simulator

Concept

Navigate a treacherous obstacle using simple and intuitive game mechanics. The idea was to create a 3D platformer that was easy to pick up and understand but difficult to master. The game is fleshed out by the level design which requires the player to use the simple mechanics in creative ways. The two main mechanics are double jumping and dashing which require precise timing and a feel for physical factors like inertia when moving on moving platforms. These two game mechanics should be mixed and matched to and used with power ups found within the level that enhance your abilities.

Code

The game was created using Unity and Javascript.

Built With

  • c#
  • javascript
  • unity
Ad

People say that the things you care about, you give your time, and the things you don’t care about, you give your money. My philosophy is if I really want to change the world, I have to give both. With Ad is how you do it. Ad is developing a cross platform iOS and Android app that accumulates user generated ad revenues. Ad will take these funds and donate them to charitable organizations. The incentives Ad provides will maximize market share for Companies, increase charitable donations to Non-Profits, and provide a smooth user experience. This rich formula will bring together three identities, the business man, the non-profiteer, and the common man, to benefit from each other. The users will have a quick and easy way to donate money to charity. Non-Profits will receive recognition from partnerships with companies and the users. Companies are given the change to align themselves with charitable organizations to enhance their brand. They will also get to Advertise to an audience fully engaged to ads, rather than a passive audience that ignores most ads on a webpage. Help me, and together we can revolution the Advertising Industry.

SAVER

SAVER is a lightweight extension to the Google Chrome browser.

How many times have you seen an interesting article, blog, or video appear on the web, but didn't have the time to check it out? How many times have you added these pages to your already mile-long bookmarks list, thinking you would actually come back to it? If you're like majority of web surfers, these habits are all too familiar. There is so much content online that catches our interest, but it seems like there will never be the right time to engage in it. SAVER is the right tool to fix this problem.

SAVER is a simple Google Chrome extention that helps its users engage in the content they want to see, at just the right time. With just ONE click, users can be directed to the pages they have saved in the past. The application simply chooses a random page from its dedicated bookmarks, allowing extremely efficient access to saved pages. If the user has seen the page and wants to remove it from the SAVER bookmarks, it can be done with a simple keyboard shortcut. SAVER is the most efficient, practical way to catch up in all the content that you always wanted to see, but felt that you never had the time to.

Check out SAVER for yourself @ https://github.com/mikejuyoon/SAVER

Built With

  • javascript
  • chrome

Just Click Present

Just Click Present is a web service that brings dynamic PowerPoint creation to the masses. Just Click Present doesn't search the web for the presentation but instead builds the deck itself using flickr and wikipedia API's. Just Click Present also has a REST endpoint that developers can use to allow the download of our custom PowerPoint files. Our target user is a high school or college student that has to present on a topic but doesn't have the time or knowledge to create a deck. We have a modern and visually appealing user interface that makes user interaction easy. We are most proud of our ability to create the dynamic PowerPoints. We integrated multiple technologies and came up with a product that we are proud of. The presentations are not perfect but are in a great place to expand upon on the technology.

The Snitch

The inspiration behind our code happened when we were attempting to register for our class that was just added. When we received the email that a new class had opened up by the time we obtained access to a computer the class had already filled up. So we decided to create a device that would immediately tell you when a new class has been added to the schools website. We were able to create a mock website and create a device that detected whenever the website changed.

Pineapples!

It all started when we were hungry and we didn't know what to cook for dinner. We needed a quick idea because we were probably losing a lb a minute. Then we thought, oh wait! Food2Fork has an API to quickly access awesome recipes around the world! Pineapples! was born.

Pineapples! is an easy to use chrome extension that allows the user to search up something they crave in their food and will search for recipes relating to the food using the Food2Fork API. It allows the user click and redirect to the original recipe page and also allows the user to bookmark the recipe to view later!

Pineapples! is for anyone who is hungry!

We am proud of this app because it is the first chrome extension we've made!
